election_record.label: Virginia 1800 Electoral College

overview.note: The District designations are taken from a chart in the National Intelligencer of February 11, 1801. Two Counties, Wood County created in 1798 and Tazewell County created in 1799 are not included in the Chart and are listed speparately at the end.

sub_unit.name: Henrico
sub_unit.note: "In Henrico county, including the city of Richmond, for the Jefferson Ticket 298 - Adams 112." Augusta Herald (Augusta, GA). November 15, 1800.

The City Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Charleston, SC), Courier (Fredericksburg), Columbian Museum and Savannah Advertiser (Savannah, GA), and the Epitome of the Times (Norfolk, VA), all give 217 votes for Jefferson in Henrico County.

sub_unit.name: Richmond
sub_unit.note: "In Henrico county, including the city of Richmond, for the Jefferson Ticket 298 - Adams 112." Augusta Herald (Augusta, GA). November 15, 1800.

For the City of Richmond, The City Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Charleston, SC), Courier (Fredericksburg), Columbian Museum and Savannah Advertiser (Savannah, GA), and the Epitome of the Times (Norfolk, VA) all give 69 votes for Adams and 81 for Jefferson.

sub_unit.name: Warwick
sub_unit.note: "Amelia, said to be unanimous for Jefferson. Nottoway, the same. Brunswick, only 15 federal, Lunenburg only 25, Sussex only 2, Chesterfield only 8, Warwick only 2." Epitome of the Times (Norfolk, VA). November 9, 1800.

sub_unit.name: Williamsburg
sub_unit.note: At the time, Williamsburg was split between James City County and York County and was not yet an independent city. The votes in Williamsburg appear to have been reported independently of either county.

sub_unit.name: Goochland
sub_unit.note: The National Intelligencer and Washington Advertiser (Washington, DC) lists 278 votes for the electors of Thomas Jefferson and 8 votes for the electors of John Adams.

sub_unit.name: Hanover
sub_unit.note: The Courier lists 43 votes for the electors of John Adams.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: The Courier lists 356 votes for the electors of Thomas Jefferson.

sub_unit.name: Spotsylvania
sub_unit.note: The National Intelligencer and Washington Advertiser (Washington, DC) lists 18 votes for for the electors of John Adams.
The Courier lists 278 votes for the electors of Thomas Jefferson and 14 votes for for the electors of John Adams.

"Fredericksburg, Nov. 4. Yesterday was the day apointed by law, for the election of electors for president and vice-president of the United States. The Freeholders of this county covened at their court-house for that purpose. It appeared from respectable authority, that the number of votes for the federal ticket did not exceed eight or nine." Augusta Herald (Augusta, GA). November 15, 1800.

sub_unit.name: Isle of Wight
sub_unit.note: The National Intelligencer and Washington Advertiser (Washington, DC) lists 251 votes for the electors of Thomas Jefferson.
The Epitome of the Times (Norfolk, VA) lists 257 votes for the electors of Jefferson.

sub_unit.name: Norfolk Borough
sub_unit.note: Though it was part of Norfolk County at the time, the official returns appear to list Norfolk Borough separately.

sub_unit.name: Norfolk
sub_unit.note: In Norfolk County the additional names of: Thomas Newton who received 3 votes, Edward Pendleton, Sr. who received 2 votes, John Penn of Gloucester who recevied 1 vote, James Madison who received 1 vote and Willam (no last name listed) of Princess Anne received 1 vote are all listed. Most of these are mis-spellings of the names of electors already listed.

sub_unit.name: Prince George
sub_unit.note: "Petersburg, Nov. 4. Republicans completely triumphant. At the final close of the poll yesterday evening...for the county of Prince George, which has always heretofore been supposed and counted upon, as among the most federal in the state, the votes were as follow:... Majority for Jefferson and liberty, 188." Augusta Herald (Augusta, GA). November 15, 1800.
"Majority for Jefferson and Liberty, 188." Columbian Museum and Savannah Advertiser (Savannah, GA). November 18, 1800.

sub_unit.name: Southampton
sub_unit.note: The Epitome of the Times (Norfolk, VA) lists 213 votes for the electors of Thomas Jefferson.

sub_unit.name: Sussex
sub_unit.note: "In Brunswick there were only 15 votes for the Adams ticket, Lunenburg 25, Sussex 2." Augusta Herald (Augusta, GA), November 15, 1800; and, Columbian Museum and Savannah Advertiser (Savannah, GA), November 18, 1800.

"Amelia, said to be unanimous for Jefferson. Nottoway, the same. Brunswick, only 15 federal, Lunenburg only 25, Sussex only 2, Chesterfield only 8, Warwick only 2." Epitome of the Times (Norfolk, VA). November 10, 1800.

sub_unit.name: Brunswick
sub_unit.note: "In Brunswick there were only 15 votes for the Adams ticket." Augusta Herald (Augusta, GA), November 15, 1800; and, Columbian Museum and Savannah Advertiser (Savannah, GA), November 18, 1800.

"Amelia, said to be unanimous for Jefferson. Nottoway, the same. Brunswick, only 15 federal, Lunenburg only 25, Sussex only 2, Chesterfield only 8, Warwick only 2." Epitome of the Times (Norfolk, VA). November 10, 1800.

sub_unit.name: Amelia
sub_unit.note: The National Intelligencer and Washington Advertiser (Washington, DC) lists 242 votes for the electors of Thomas Jefferson.

"Amelia, said to be unanimous for Jefferson. Nottoway, the same. Brunswick only 15 votes for federal, Lunenburg only 25, Sussex only 2, Chesterfield only 8, Warwick only 2." Epitome of the Times (Norfolk, VA). November 10, 1800.

sub_unit.name: Chesterfield
sub_unit.note: "In Brunswick there were only 15 votes for Adams ticket, Lunenburg 25, Sussex 2, Chesterfield 8." Augusta Herald (Augusta, GA), November 15, 1800; and, Columbian Museum and Savannah Advertiser (Savannah, GA), November 21, 1800.

"Amelia, said to be unanimous for Jefferson. Nottoway, the same. Brunswick, only 15 federal, Lunenburg only 25, Sussex only 2, Chesterfield only 8, Warwick only 2" Epitome of the Times (Norfolk, VA). November 10, 1800.

sub_unit.name: Nottaway
sub_unit.note: "Amelia, said to be unanimous for Jefferson. Nottoway, the same. Brunswick, only 15 federal, Lunenburg only 25, Sussex only 2, Chesterfield only 8, Warwick only 2." Epitome of the Times (Norfolk, VA). November 10, 1800.

sub_unit.name: Lunenburg
sub_unit.note: "In Brunswick there were only 15 votes for Adams ticket, Lunenburg 25, ." Augusta Herald (Augusta, GA), November 15, 1800; and, Columbian Museum and Savannah Advertiser (Savannah, GA), November 21, 1800.

"Amelia, said to be unanimous for Jefferson. Nottoway, the same. Brunswick, only 15 federal, Lunenburg only 25, Sussex only 2, Chesterfield only 8, Warwick only 2." Epitome of the Times (Norfolk, VA). November 10, 1800.

sub_unit.name: King George
sub_unit.note: The National Intelligencer and Washington Advertiser (Washington, DC) lists 43 votes for the electors of John Adams.
The Courier lists 47 votes for the electors of John Adams.

sub_unit.name: Richmond
sub_unit.note: The National Intelligencer and Washington Advertiser (Washington, DC) lists 23 votes for the electors of John Adams.

sub_unit.name: Sixteen
sub_unit.note: "The election for Electors in this district took place on Monday last - as follows is the state of the poll: Frederick, Jacobin ticket, 527, Federal do. 211, Berkeley, Jacobin ticket 428, Federal do. 366." Winchester Gazette (Winchester, VA). November 5, 1800.

sub_unit.name: Augusta
sub_unit.note: "Staunton (Virg.) Nov.5 - State of the poll at the election for Augusta county, for Electors of a President and Vice-President of the United States. Alexander Saint Clair (Federal) 462, Archibald Stewart (Anti-Federal) 237" The Philadelphia Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). November 15, 1800.

sub_unit.name: Rockingham
sub_unit.note: The National Intelligencer and Washington Advertiser (Washington, DC) lists 219 votes for the electors of Thomas Jefferson and 164 votes for the electors of John Adams.

sub_unit.name: Kanawha
sub_unit.note: No Returns.

sub_unit.name: Brooke
sub_unit.note: The National Intelligencer and Washington Advertiser (Washington, DC) lists 211 votes for the electors of Thomas Jefferson and 69 votes for the electors of John Adams.

sub_unit.name: Randolph
sub_unit.note: The National Intelligencer and Washington Advertiser (Washington, DC) lists 22 votes for the electors of John Adams.

sub_unit.name: Fauquier
sub_unit.note: The Courier lists 132 votes for the electors of John Adams.
